title: Portrait of Richard Weston, First Earl of Portland
credit_line: Bequest of Mrs. J. Willis Dalzell
provenance_text:
John Levy Galleries, New York, NY, until April 1919; Mrs. J. Willis Dalzell (Mary Beer Dalzell) [1844-1929], Pittsburgh, PA, April 3, 1919 until February 13, 1929; Mary B. Dalzell estate, February 1929; bequest to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, February 1929.

Notes:
Purchased as "Portrait of Jerome Weston" for $5,000 (see John Levy list of Mrs. Dalzell's purchases, dated April 8, 1919, in donor file.)
The painting was collected from Mrs. Dalzell's residence on Ridge Avenue in Pittsburgh and brought to Carnegie Institute on February 19, 1929. It was accessioned on February 25, 1929.

Updated and under review by CGK
